Okay, so you are watching a video from one of the most beautiful channels about physics on YouTube, and you are focusing on the first sentence that he said, when he hasn't even started yet talking about stars (which is his field, and probably the reason why you started watching the video). Can't you simply ignore that sentence? And if you can't, can you really begin a discussion with Henry with that sentence in mind that he said? He only said that in some cases it's actually difficult to distinguish if a person is a man or a women, but we often need to do so. And this is not offensive, in my opinion (surely he didn't say that sentence for that purpose): it happens all the time. Transgender people has been in doubt at least once in their lives, asking if their body represents theirselves, if that is important, what can they do... And genderfluid people don't even feel a single answer in their lives. But of course cisgender people (like me) need to say "he is transgender", "she/he is genderfluid", because we have to give names to things (and probably don't have the right pronouns). We also expect that the suddivision is clear and without doubt, when it is really very ambiguous sometimes. Just think about bisexual and sexually fluid: we know the difference between them in theory. But in reality, a bisexual person has often periods during which he/she is mostly attracted to women, and then others when he/she is mostly attracted to men; so actually a person should defines his/her sexual identity regardless of names and strict definitions, and probably a full description is sometimes better than a name.

I always find it strange that compact stellar remnants are referred to as "corpses" or "dead stars"... I simply find the analogy of death to be rather unfitting... after all that compact state they are the most long-lived period for many massive objects. A better analogy would be that the time at which fusion occurs is the gestation period that eventually results in the birth of these compact objects.
After all they may come a time when most stellar mass will be these compact stars (leaving brown dwarfs that have cooled down aside).

Black holes are not holes. Black holes cannot be holes. The larger, or more dense an object is, (or the more mass an object has) the more gravity it has, thus the more objects it can pull. (remember this) Black holes are created through the collapse of stars. Not all stars create black holes though, they create small, but extremely dense white dwarfs, which have the mass many times greater than that of our own Sun. White dwarfs are only created by the collapse of smaller stars, contrary to the collapse of larger stars which create black holes in a fantastic supernova. (I am only thinking logically here and everything is unscientifically unsupported) Black holes have more mass than white dwarfs, so much condensed mass that they absorb light, the fastest known object in the universe, due to this obviously they are "black", and unable to be seen, only as a shadow to the light of stars. Here is the theory: black holes are extremely condensed objects of mass, such as that of white dwarfs, super-compressed by the supreme collapse of stars themselves. Black holes don't "suck" things in like a vacuum, but are rather pulled in by the immense gravity by the extreme mass of the black hole. So much that they pull in light itself, thus we cannot see them, thus we think of them as "holes." The more mass it absorbs, the larger the black hole becomes, behaving like a planet. The reason why we cannot see that mass is due to (̶p̶o̶s̶s̶i̶b̶l̶y̶)̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶i̶m̶m̶e̶n̶s̶e̶ ̶g̶r̶a̶v̶i̶t̶y̶ ̶b̶l̶o̶c̶k̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶o̶u̶r̶ ̶s̶e̶n̶s̶e̶s̶,̶ ̶o̶r̶ ̶t̶h̶a̶t̶ ̶s̶a̶m̶e̶ ̶i̶m̶m̶e̶n̶s̶e̶ ̶g̶r̶a̶v̶i̶t̶y̶ ̶t̶u̶r̶n̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶t̶h̶a̶t̶ ̶m̶a̶t̶t̶e̶r̶ ̶i̶n̶t̶o̶ ̶s̶o̶m̶e̶t̶h̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶t̶r̶a̶n̶s̶p̶a̶r̶e̶n̶t̶ ̶w̶e̶ ̶c̶a̶n̶n̶o̶t̶ ̶s̶e̶e̶,̶ ̶d̶u̶e̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶a̶l̶m̶o̶s̶t̶ ̶i̶n̶f̶i̶n̶i̶t̶e̶ ̶g̶r̶a̶v̶i̶t̶y̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶b̶l̶a̶c̶k̶ ̶h̶o̶l̶e̶.̶ the light being absorbed by it, and thus we cannot see it or anything near it. To summarize, black holes are not holes, but rather extremely super-condensed objects we believe are holes due to their transparency, which is due to the light being absorbed by the extreme gravity from the density, and everything surrounding it also being absorbed by that gravity.

Gotta love all these triggered regressives raging at the man - woman remark.
Biology doesn't do clear cut dichotomies. Not between species of the same family, not between phyla, not even between individuals of a sexually dimorphic species. The blueprint for human beings is identical for both sexes at conception and only starts producing differences due to hormone regulation caused by gene expression and environmental factors etc.

Genetic sex determines whether you have an X or a Y sex chromosome, but the sensations of self, continuity, identity and consciousness emerge from the synergy of various areas of the brain, not directly from DNA. Anyone who has taken a single glance at comparative neuroanatomy can clearly see the overwhelming similarities and minute, variable differences between XX brains and XY brains.

The idea that manhood v. womanhood is a black and white dichotomy of absolutes just like genetic sex only shows your ignorance of embryology and genetics. It's like saying two paintings based on the same sketch are always perfectly identical. All of biology is divided by arbitrary, fuzzy lines in stead of the clear cut, regular division our primitive brains like to project onto the world. Even consciousness is a gradual scale for fuck's sake.

"HURR DURR DRAGON IS A GENDER NOW" does not make for a good argument about biology. It shows you're willfully ignorant and entirely dogmatic about how little you know. Trump is trying to meme that arrogant stupidity is a badge of honor, but it really isn't.

There's actually a way I know in which gender can be a foggy matter. I have no actual citement, but I learned it from my teacher and it sounds reasonable.
When the child is on the womb it has already defined gender in its chromosomes, but there's no other difference between male and female. If the chromosomes are XY the mother produces hormones that incite the development of the male genitalia. When it's XX the mother doesn't need to produce any hormones. But sometimes, for unknown reasons, the mother produces the hormone when she doesn't have to or vice versa and you end up with someone with the wrong gender for what their chromosomes say.

I have a question for a future video, it's not your usual video idea but I think it's interesting nonetheless.
So I was playing tennis with a friend of mine and I was loosing (15-30) so I thought to myself "should I try to aim at the edge of the field, which means I have a bigger chance to miss and loose the point or should I try to aim more towards the center of the field so that I assure myself I don't miss.
This could be the case in any sport really. If football/soccer should you shoot for the corner if you are winning or for the center?
I would like to have a mathematical answer for which gives me a bigger chance to win. And does the answer depend on things like how good you are at the game or has many points you have to get to recover?
I think it would make for an interesting video topic that is useful at the same time :)

I think that some people are born into a gender they don't feel comfortable with, they have gender dysphoria. However we're talking about a very small number of people. The fact that they have to go through surgery to change their sex suggests that they feel they are in the wrong category and would like to move. If there wasn't a clear category difference they wouldn't need the surgery. For the most part, men and women are biologically different and these biological differences make a big difference to the way people of different sexes view the world and interact with others. It's not just social indoctrination, biological differences cause people to drift into different modes of thinking. However, many women are happy to and highly competent at doing jobs that men traditionally do and vice versa. Don't let sex hold you back if you're a guy and you like girly things. Similarly, if you're a girl and you like girly things that's also something we should be happy with. We don't have to encourage everyone to be different for the sake of it, instead if someone is different we just accept it.

What you said about the formation of black holes is different from what I saw over on PBS Space Time.
They said that neutron degeneracy pressure can't be overcome by anything we know of so instead the collapse happens because of Heisenberg's uncertainty principle. The location of every neutron is very strongly defined so their velocities become extremely uncertain so they start occupying room in threedimensional phase space. As a quantum effect the neutron star starts to shrink the more massive it gets and once it gets smaller than the Schwarzschild radius it becomes a black hole.

OMG! People, take a sociology class and learn the difference between gender and sex!
Sex: the biological traits of their genitalia
Gender: What the person psychologically identifies themselves as, or the social and cultural label put on someone defining their identity
Finally there isn't a political message here. There ARE people born with both genitalia (both a penis and a vagina), but yes these are rare circumstance that is a result of birth defects. Therefore, they do exist. There are also many animals in the animal kingdom that have the qualities of both male and female, not as a deformity but as their natural state. In fact, some animal can even change their sex (not their gender) from male to female or vice versa.
Just google "animals that have both sexes" and you'll find a huge list of them.
